main event: On June 13, 1957, in Glen Burnie, Maryland, an unidentified flying object was reported, described as a bright light that hovered motionless and then accelerated and disappeared.
interesting points: The object did not produce any sound.
The report was analyzed by Major James E. O'Brien of the USAF's Aerial Phenomena and Intelligence division.
The observer, a civilian in Glen Burnie, Maryland, reported the object declining while standing in one yard.
Weather conditions at the time of the sighting were reported as clear with calm surface winds.
The investigating Captain indicated that a high-flying aircraft was in the vicinity at the time of the sighting.
result: identified as a high-flying aircraft, therefore not a UFO
sighted object: unidentified flying object described as a bright light
photographs: no photographs included in the report
